name: The Connection
description:
A first-person puzzle game about exploration and connecting loose ends.

The game is set a large, cluttered world made completely out of colorless cubes. This world contains a set of complex-looking puzzles, where each individual corner of a shape can be rotated in 90-degree angles. There's no tutorial nor any proper explanation, which means it's up to you to find out how to solve the puzzles.

It takes about an hour to complete the game, however this varies a lot based on how well you do. There are also several well-hidden secrets to find.

I made this in a week for Game Jolt's Chaos Contest back in March 2013, and has been updated a few times since then with more content.
